int CScrollbar::setReverseDirectionOn ( )
 

int CScrollbar::setReverseDirectionOff ( )
 

int CScrollbar::isReverseDirection ( )
 

If on, display the maximum value at the top or left, depending on the orientation. Default is off.

int CScrollbar::setIncrement ( int increment )
 

The value the widget will scroll by when the user clicks the arrow buttons.

int CScrollbar::setMinimum ( int minimum )
 

The minimum scrollbar value

int CScrollbar::setMaximum ( int maximum )
 

The maximum scrollbar value

int CScrollbar::setRange ( int minimum,
int maximum )
 

The range of the scrollbar (Same as calling setMinimum and setMaximum)

int CScrollbar::setHorizontalOrientation ( )
 

Sets the scrollbar to horizontal orientation

int CScrollbar::setVerticalOrientation ( )
 

Sets the scrollbar to vertical orientation

int CScrollbar::setMinimumSliderSize ( int minimumSliderSize )
 

The minimum length of the handle, in pixels

int CScrollbar::setPageIncrement ( int pageIncrement )
 

The handle increment to be used when the scrollbar is moved by a page. If this value is -1, the value set by setSliderSize is used

int CScrollbar::setPosition ( int position )
 

int CScrollbar::getPosition ( )
 

The current handle value

int CScrollbar::setSliderSize ( int sliderSize )
 

The length of the handle. In the range of 1 to (maximum - minimum) (Values set by setMinimum/setMaximum) Default is one-tenth of the specified range.

int CScrollbar::setRenderAsFocusedOn ( )
 

int CScrollbar::setRenderAsFocusedOff ( )
 

int CScrollbar::isRenderAsFocused ( )
 

If on, causes the scrollbar to be rendered as if it has focus even if it doesn't. This is useful in applications where one widget collects keystrokes and directs specific keys to other widgets.

int CScrollbar::setArrowsOn ( )
 

int CScrollbar::setArrowsOff ( )
 

int CScrollbar::isArrows ( )
 

Displays arrow buttons at the ends of the trough

void CScrollbar::addScrollMoveCallback ( PtCallbackF_t callbackFunction,
void * data = 0 )
 

The list of callbacks that the scrollbar invokes when the scroll position changes. If the widget has the Pt_CALLBACKS_ACTIVE bit set in its Pt_ARG_FLAGS resource, this callback is also invoked when the position of the scrollbar is changed by a call to PtSetResources().
